# hardware

[![GitHub release](https://img.shields.io/github/release/crystal-community/hardware.svg)](https://github.com/crystal-community/hardware/releases)
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/crystal-community/hardware.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/crystal-community/hardware)

This is a very basic module to help get CPU and memory usage of the current running OS

Tested on Linux.

## Installation

Add this to your application's `shard.yml`:

```yaml
dependencies:
  hardware:
    github: crystal-community/hardware
```

## Documentation

The documentation is accessible at https://crystal-community.github.io/hardware.

It is generated with [crystal docs](https://crystal-lang.org/docs/conventions/documenting_code.html) in the `gh-pages` branch.

## Examples

```crystal
require "hardware"

memory = Hardware::Memory.new
memory.used         #=> 2731404
memory.percent.to_i #=> 32

cpu = Hardware::CPU.new
pid = Hardware::PID.new           # Default is Process.pid
app = Hardware::PID.new "firefox" # Take the first matching PID

loop do
  sleep 1
  cpu.used.to_i     #=> 17
  pid.cpu_used      #=> 1.5
  app.cpu_used.to_i #=> 4
end
```
## Development

### Docker

You can run the specs in a Docker container:

```sh
$ docker-compose up
$ docker-compose run spec
```

instance_methods.name: info
instance_methods.doc: Returns the current used, idle and total CPU time.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the current used, idle and total CPU time.

def.name: info
def.return_type: NamedTuple(used: Int32, idle: Int32, total: Int32)
def.body:
stat
{used: used = ((((user + nice) + system) + irq) + softirq) + steal, idle: idle_cpu = idle + iowait, total: used + idle_cpu}

instance_methods.name: used
instance_methods.doc: Returns the CPU used in percentage based on `.previous_info`.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the CPU used in percentage based on .previous_info.

def.name: used
def.body:
current_info = info
result = ((current_info[:used] - @@previous_info[:used]).to_f32 / (current_info[:total] - @@previous_info[:total])) * 100
if update
  @@previous_info = current_info
end
result

types.name: PID
types.doc:
All informations related to the Processes running on your sytem, defined by Process IDentifiers.

```
pid = Hardware::PID.new           # Default is Process.pid
app = Hardware::PID.new "firefox" # Take the first matching PID

loop do
  sleep 1
  pid.cpu_used      # => 1.5
  app.cpu_used.to_i # => 4
end
```
types.summary: All informations related to the Processes running on your sytem, defined by Process IDentifiers.

class_methods.name: all
class_methods.doc: Yields a `Hardware::PID` for each PID present on the system.
class_methods.summary: Yields a Hardware::PID for each PID present on the system.

def.name: all
def.body:
Dir.each_child("/proc") do |pid_dir|
  if pid = pid_dir.to_i?
    yield Hardware::PID.new(pid: pid, cpu_time: cpu_time, cpu_total: cpu_total)
  end
end

class_methods.name: get_pids
class_methods.doc: Return all pids corresponding of a given `executable` name.
class_methods.summary: Return all pids corresponding of a given executable name.

def.name: get_pids
def.body:
pids = Array(Int32).new
all(cpu_time: false, cpu_total: false) do |pid|
  pid_name = pid.name
  if pid_name == executable
    pids << pid.pid
  end
end
pids

instance_methods.name: cpu_time
instance_methods.doc: Returns the CPU time without including ones from `children` processes.
instance_methods.summary: Returns the CPU time without including ones from children processes.

def.name: cpu_time
def.body:
stat
if children
  ((utime + stime) + cutime) + cstime
else
  utime + stime
end

instance_methods.name: cpu_used
instance_methods.doc: Returns the CPU used in percentage.

def.name: cpu_used
def.body:
cpu_time_current = cpu_time
if @cpu_total
  @@cpu_total_current = CPU.new.info[:total]
end
result = 100 * ((cpu_time_current - @cpu_time_previous.to_f32) / (@@cpu_total_current - @cpu_total_previous))
if @cpu_time
  @cpu_time_previous = cpu_time_current
end
@cpu_total_previous = @@cpu_total_current
result

def.name: exe
def.body:
begin
  if File.readable?(path = "/proc/#{@pid}/exe")
    File.real_path(path)
  end
rescue
  nil
end

def.name: status
def.body:
status_hash = Hash(String, String).new
(read_proc("status")).each_line do |line|
  key, value = line.split(":\t")
  status_hash[key] = value
end
status_hash
